cluster_relations.rel_desc: Fruits contain seeds that are later dispersed.

qualifiers.CausalHint: then spread seeds after fruit consumption

remarks: Relation supported by process description plus entity definitions, not an explicit 'contain' clause in the prose.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Birds disperse seeds by flying and excreting them in different locations.

qualifiers.SpatialQualifier: far and wide in different locations
qualifiers.CausalHint: consume fruits and then spread seeds

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject physically contains the object as a component or part within its boundaries.
args.justification: The relation describes seeds being located inside fruits as components that are later dispersed; this is a stable physical part-whole containment relation, so the canonical predicate 'contains' fits well.
The relation expresses a part-whole structure (seeds as components within fruits), which is best modeled as a physical component / part relation rather than a generic association.
The semantics are about the compositional makeup of fruits (they are composed in part of seeds), which falls under a broad composition / part-whole grouping.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject acts to spread or transport the object from one location to others, typically as part of a dispersal process.
args.justification: The description states that birds spread seeds to different locations after fruit consumption; this is a clear dispersal action, so the canonical predicate 'disperses' directly matches the intended meaning.
The relation involves active movement and spreading of seeds by birds as vectors; this fits a general class of dispersal or transport-by-agent relations rather than simple spatial co-occurrence.

Birds are acting as agents that cause the movement of seeds; the core semantics center on an agent performing an action on an object, which aligns with an AGENCY-oriented group more than pure spatiality or composition.
